title: 5k-Mile 2014 SRT Viper Coupe
description: This 2014 SRT Viper was purchased by the seller on BaT in July 2023 and has 5k miles. The car is powered by an 8.4-liter V10 linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential, and it is finished in Billet Silver Metallic over black leather upholstery. Equipment includes the Exterior Carbon-Fiber Package, 18″ and 19″ Sidewinder II alloy wheels, xenon headlights, Sabelt bucket seats, a backup camera, navigation, and automatic climate control. This Viper is offered by the seller on behalf of the current owner with a clean Carfax report and a clean New Jersey title in the owner's name.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a 5k-Mile 2014 SRT Viper Coupe at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #202,365.
text: This 2014 SRT Viper was purchased by the seller on BaT in July 2023 and has 5k miles. The car is powered by an 8.4-liter V10 linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential, and it is finished in Billet Silver Metallic over black leather upholstery. Equipment includes the Exterior Carbon-Fiber Package, 18″ and 19″ Sidewinder II alloy wheels, xenon headlights, Sabelt bucket seats, a backup camera, navigation, and automatic climate control. This Viper is offered by the seller on behalf of the current owner with a clean Carfax report and a clean New Jersey title in the owner’s name. The fifth-generation Viper featured a carbon-fiber hood, roof, and decklid as well as aluminum door panels. This example is finished in Billet Silver Metallic and features xenon headlights, an SRT-specific vented hood, an illuminating Stryker third brake light, LED taillights, an integrated rear spoiler, and dual side exhaust outlets. The Exterior Carbon-Fiber Package added a carbon-fiber rear applique and brake duct bezels. The 18″ and 19″ Sidewinder II alloy wheels are mounted with 295/30 front and 355/30 rear Pirelli P Zero tires. Stopping power is provided by black-finished Viper-branded Brembo calipers fitted over ventilated rotors at each corner. The interior features Sabelt bucket seats upholstered in black leather. Equipment includes keyless entry, an 8.4″ navigation system, a backup camera, power-adjustable pedals, automatic climate control, and cruise control. A Harman Kardon stereo and additional speakers were installed under prior ownership. The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a 220-mph speedometer and a digital tachometer with an illuminating Stryker shift indicator as well as a fuel-level gauge. The digital odometer indicates 5k miles, approximately 100 of which were added under current ownership. The hand-assembled 8.4-liter V10 was factory rated at 640 horsepower and 600 lb-ft of torque. An aluminum structural X-brace spans the engine bay. The battery was replaced in 2023 and an oil change was performed in preparation for the sale. Power is sent to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission and a 3.55:1 limited-slip differential. The window sticker lists initial delivery to Woodhouse Chrysler Jeep Dodge in Blair, Nebraska, factory equipment, and a total suggested retail price of $114,780. html:
This 2014 SRT Viper was purchased by the seller on BaT in July 2023 and has 5k miles. The car is powered by an 8.4-liter V10 linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential, and it is finished in Billet Silver Metallic over black leather upholstery. Equipment includes the Exterior Carbon-Fiber Package, 18″ and 19″ Sidewinder II alloy wheels, xenon headlights, Sabelt bucket seats, a backup camera, navigation, and automatic climate control. This Viper is offered by the seller on behalf of the current owner with a clean Carfax report and a clean New Jersey title in the owner’s name.

The fifth-generation Viper featured a carbon-fiber hood, roof, and decklid as well as aluminum door panels. This example is finished in Billet Silver Metallic and features xenon headlights, an SRT-specific vented hood, an illuminating Stryker third brake light, LED taillights, an integrated rear spoiler, and dual side exhaust outlets. The Exterior Carbon-Fiber Package added a carbon-fiber rear applique and brake duct bezels.

The 18″ and 19″ Sidewinder II alloy wheels are mounted with 295/30 front and 355/30 rear Pirelli P Zero tires. Stopping power is provided by black-finished Viper-branded Brembo calipers fitted over ventilated rotors at each corner.

The interior features Sabelt bucket seats upholstered in black leather. Equipment includes keyless entry, an 8.4″ navigation system, a backup camera, power-adjustable pedals, automatic climate control, and cruise control. A Harman Kardon stereo and additional speakers were installed under prior ownership.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a 220-mph speedometer and a digital tachometer with an illuminating Stryker shift indicator as well as a fuel-level gauge. The digital odometer indicates 5k miles, approximately 100 of which were added under current ownership.

The hand-assembled 8.4-liter V10 was factory rated at 640 horsepower and 600 lb-ft of torque. An aluminum structural X-brace spans the engine bay. The battery was replaced in 2023 and an oil change was performed in preparation for the sale.

Power is sent to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission and a 3.55:1 limited-slip differential.

The window sticker lists initial delivery to Woodhouse Chrysler Jeep Dodge in Blair, Nebraska, factory equipment, and a total suggested retail price of $114,780.

The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.
